result.execSummary:
The defendant Jaz H.J. Greyhair was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample unless already provided.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent.  AODA/treatment per agent.  Not to possess controlled substances w/o valid prescription and must notify agent w/in 48 hours if one is received.  Absolute Sobriety of alcohol & drugs.  DE has 2 days credit if probation revoked.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jaz H.J. Greyhair in court with attorney Debra Van Wormer O'Rourke.  Defendant Jaz H.J. Greyhair in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty O'Rourke states matter is resolved.  DE to waive prelim and proceed to arraignment and then to plea/sentencing today.  Atty O'Rourke states recs.  State agrees.  Court questions DE on prelim waiver/accepts/finds probable cause and binds over.  Atty O'Rourke acknowledges rec. information, waives reading.  Court advises DE of charge/max penalty.  Atty O'Rourke enters NC plea.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on plea/accepts/finds guilty and sentences.  DE advised of felony firearm warnings, voting rights and appeal rights.

Ct 1:  NC
Probation for 24 months
Conditions of probation:
Costs/surcharges of $518.00 to be paid per agent during term of probation
AODA/Treatment and any other counseling per agent
Absolute sobriety at all times from alcohol and controlled substances w/o valid prescription and only if used accordingly
If a prescription is received the DE must notify the agent w/in two workings days
DNA sample to be provided unless one has previously been provided
2 days sentence credit to be applied only if probation is revoked
Return date on March 5, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Attorney Debra Van Wormer O'Rourke in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney ORourke advises defendant is in Jackson County Jail on revocation status.  OTP needed.  Return date scheduled for March 5, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
no possession of any drugs w/o valid Rx

Pre-trial conference on February 6, 2015 at 09:15 am.
Return date on February 19, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Jaz H.J. Greyhair appeared by video means with Attorney Dolch. Prosecuting Atty Kevin R. Calkins appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant qualifies for public defender.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.   Time limits waived. $500.00 SIGNATURE bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: No possession of any drugs w/out valid Rx.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 6, 2015 at 09:15 am.  Return date scheduled for February 19, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
